appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.description: Customize how the application looks and feels.

language.label: Language
language.helper: Choose your preferred language. Browser Default follows your system language.

taskExecution.title: Default Coding Agent
taskExecution.description: Choose the default coding agent for tasks.

executor.label: Default Agent Configuration
executor.helper: Choose the default agent configuration to use when creating a task attempt.

type.label: Editor Type
type.helper: Choose your preferred code editor interface.

customCommand.label: Custom Editor Command
customCommand.helper: Enter the command to launch your custom editor. This will be used to open files.

host.label: Remote SSH Host (Optional)
host.helper: Set this if Vibe Kanban is running on a remote server. When set, clicking "Open in Editor" will generate a URL to open your editor via SSH instead of spawning a local command.

user.label: Remote SSH User (Optional)
user.helper: SSH username for the remote connection. If not set, VS Code will use your SSH config or prompt you.

cliSetup.title: GitHub CLI Setup
cliSetup.description: GitHub CLI authentication is required to create pull requests and interact with GitHub repositories.

steps.checkInstalled: Check if GitHub CLI (gh) is installed
steps.installHomebrew: Install it via Homebrew if needed (macOS)

cliSetup.setupNote: The setup will run in the chat window. You'll need to complete the authentication in your browser.

errors.brewMissing: Homebrew is not installed. Install it to enable automatic setup.
errors.notSupported: Automatic setup is not supported on this platform. Install GitHub CLI manually.
errors.setupFailed: Failed to run GitHub CLI setup.

homebrew.description: Automatic installation requires Homebrew. Install Homebrew from
homebrew.manualInstall: and then rerun the setup. Alternatively, install GitHub CLI manually with:

manual.andAuthenticate: and then authenticate with your GitHub account.

branchPrefix.label: Branch Prefix
branchPrefix.helper: Prefix for auto-generated branch names. Leave empty for no prefix.

workspaceDir.label: Workspace Directory
workspaceDir.helper: Workspaces will be created in a .vibe-kanban-workspaces subdirectory within this path. Leave empty to use the system default. Changes require an app restart.
workspaceDir.dialogDescription: Choose a directory. Workspaces will be created in a .vibe-kanban-workspaces subdirectory within it.

autoDescription.label: Auto-generate PR description by default
autoDescription.helper: When enabled, the AI agent will automatically update the PR title and description after creation.

customPrompt.helper: Custom prompt for the AI agent when generating PR descriptions. Use {pr_number} and {pr_url} as placeholders.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Control when and how you receive notifications.

sound.label: Sound Notifications
sound.helper: Play a sound when task attempts finish running.
sound.fileHelper: Choose the sound to play when tasks complete. Click the volume button to preview.

push.label: Push Notifications
push.helper: Show system notifications when task attempts finish running.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description: Help improve Vibe-Kanban by sharing anonymous usage data.

telemetry.label: Enable Telemetry
telemetry.helper: Enables anonymous usage events tracking to help improve the application. No prompts or project information are collected.

taskTemplates.title: Tags
taskTemplates.description: Create reusable text snippets that can be inserted into task descriptions using @tag_name.

manager.title: Task Tags
manager.noTags: No tags yet. Create reusable text snippets for common task descriptions. Use @tag_name in any task.
manager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the tag "{{tagName}}"?

tagName.label: Tag Name
tagName.hint: Use this name with @ in task descriptions: @{{tagName}}
tagName.error: Tag name cannot contain spaces. Use underscores instead (e.g., my_tag)

content.label: Content
content.hint: Text that will be inserted when you use @{{tagName}} in task descriptions
content.placeholder: Enter the text that will be inserted when you use this tag

safety.title: Safety & Disclaimers
safety.description: Reset acknowledgments for safety warnings and onboarding.

beta.title: Beta Features
beta.description: Try out experimental features before they're released.

workspaces.label: Enable Workspaces Beta
workspaces.helper: Use the new workspaces interface when viewing task attempts. Tasks will open in task view first, and attempts will open in the new workspaces view.

commitReminder.label: Commit reminder
commitReminder.helper: Prompt supported agents to commit changes before stopping.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage
dataStorage.description: Configure where your application data is stored.

currentPath.label: Current Data Location
currentPath.helper: All configuration files, databases, and credentials are stored here.

changePath.label: Change Storage Location
changePath.helper: Select a folder to store your data. Useful for syncing via iCloud, Dropbox, or other cloud services.

picker.title: Select Data Storage Folder
picker.description: Choose a folder where all application data will be stored. For multi-device sync, select a cloud-synced folder.

warnings.credentials: Note: Your credentials.json file contains sensitive authentication tokens. It will remain in the old location for security.

reset.helper: Revert to the system default data directory.
reset.confirm: Are you sure you want to reset to the default storage location? The custom path configuration will be removed, but files will not be moved automatically.

errors.resetFailed: Failed to reset to default path.
errors.emptyPath: Please select a valid folder path.

dataManagement.title: Data Management
dataManagement.description: Manage configuration, sessions, and repository paths

configSource.note: Note: Click "Reload Configuration" to apply configuration changes without restarting the application.

switchSource.title: Switch Configuration Source
switchSource.description: Change to a different configuration directory (e.g., for multi-device sync)

requirementsList: Directory must exist and contain config.json file
Choose to copy existing configuration to new location
configSource.copyExisting: Copy existing configuration files to new location
importantList: After switching, the application will use configuration from the new location
Ensure the new directory is accessible with correct permissions

sessionDirectory.title: Session Directory
sessionDirectory.description: Location where task sessions are saved as Markdown files

repos.title: Repository Path Validation
repos.description: Check and fix invalid repository paths for cross-device usage
repos.clickScan: Click "Scan Repositories" to check repository paths
repos.foundInvalidRepos: Found {{count}} invalid repositories. Please fix them individually.

exportConfig.title: Export Configuration
exportConfig.description: Download your application configuration as a JSON file

exportSessions.title: Export Sessions
exportSessions.description: Download all session files as a ZIP archive

importConfig.title: Import Configuration
importConfig.description: Import a previously exported configuration file
noteList: Import will merge with existing configuration
Paths may need adjustment when used across devices

toasts.importedSuccessfully: Configuration imported successfully. Please restart the application.

agents.title: Coding Agent Configurations
agents.description: Customize the behavior of coding agents with different configurations.

availability.loginDetectedTooltip: Recent authentication credentials found for this agent
availability.installationFoundTooltip: Agent configuration found. You may need to log in to use it.

errors.deleteFailed: Failed to delete configuration. Please try again.
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save agent configurations. Please try again.
errors.saveConfigFailed: Failed to save configuration. Please try again.

mcp.title: MCP Server Configuration
mcp.description: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend coding agent capabilities with custom tools and resources.

labels.agentHelper: Choose which agent to configure MCP servers for.
labels.serverHelper: Click a card to insert that MCP Server into the JSON above.

errors.applyFailed: Failed to apply MCP server configuration
errors.supportMessage: To use MCP servers, please select a different executor that supports MCP (Claude, Amp, Gemini, Codex, or Opencode) above.

selector.label: Select Project
selector.helper: Select a project to view and edit its configuration.

name.label: Project Name
name.helper: A display name for this project.

repoPath.label: Git Repository Path
repoPath.helper: The absolute path to your git repository on disk.

save.confirmSwitch: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to switch projects? Your changes will be lost.

repos.title: Repository Configuration
repos.description: Configure scripts that run when this repository is used in workspaces.

selector.label: Select Repository
selector.helper: Select a repository to view and edit its configuration.

displayName.label: Display Name
displayName.helper: A friendly name for this repository.

scripts.title: Scripts & Configuration
scripts.description: Configure dev server, setup, cleanup, and copy files for this repository. These scripts run whenever the repository is used in any workspace.

setup.label: Setup Script
setup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after it's created and before the coding agent starts. Use it for setup tasks like installing dependencies or preparing the environment.
setup.parallelLabel: Run setup script in parallel with coding agent
setup.parallelHelper: When enabled, the setup script runs simultaneously with the coding agent instead of waiting for setup to complete first.

cleanup.label: Cleanup Script
cleanup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after coding agent execution, only if changes were made. Use it for quality assurance tasks like running linters, formatters, tests, or other validation steps.

copyFiles.label: Copy Files
copyFiles.helper: Comma-separated list of files to copy from the original repository directory to the worktree. Useful for environment files like .env. Make sure these are gitignored!
copyFiles.placeholder: File paths or glob patterns (e.g., .env, config/*.json)

devServer.label: Dev Server Script
devServer.helper: Starts a development server for this repository. Scripts execute from within the repository's worktree directory.

save.confirmSwitch: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to switch repositories? Your changes will be lost.
